derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in sense 2): from cock + pit.  In the early 18th cent. the term was in nautical use, denoting an area in the aft lower deck of a man-of-war where the wounded were taken, later coming to mean 'the ‘pit’ or well in a sailing yacht from which it was steered'; hence the place housing the controls of other vehicles. (sense 1, early 20th cent.)

entry.tran: (飞机的)驾驶舱，座舱;(赛车的)驾驶座
entry.def: In an aeroplane or racing car, the cockpit is the part where the pilot or driver sits.

means.word_mean: 1. compartment where the pilot sits while flying the aircraft
3. seat where the driver sits while driving a racing car
